revised_title: Isoprenaline, Calcium, and Rate Changes: Effects on Tension Reactivation and Potentiation in Guinea Pig Atrium
tldr: This study investigates the effects of isoprenaline, calcium levels, and stimulation rate changes on tension reactivation and potentiation in guinea pig atrium. The results show that isoprenaline speeds up tension repriming, while reducing extracellular calcium slows it down. Increases in stimulation rate enhance tension repriming in a control medium but this rate-dependence is absent in the presence of isoprenaline. Isoprenaline abolishes post-extrasystolic potentiation, and a reduced calcium supply partly restores it. These findings suggest that isoprenaline affects the degree of sarcoplasmic reticulum filling and the rate of calcium recycling within these stores.
